 'eventCategory': 'event_category',

id="post-32915" class="post-32915 page type-page status-publish"><div class="entry-content post-content"><div id="vc_row-6609055ee0445" class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid"><div class="wpb_column id="tgpli-6609055ee7ba3"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7ba3')</script></div><div class="fullwidth-block-inner"><div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 130px"><span class="vc_empty_space_inner"></span></div><div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_flipInX flipInX custom-font wpb_start_animation animated"><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="title-h1" style="text-align: center; font-size: 60px;"><span style="color: #f68c12;">Discover</span></div></div></div><div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_flipInX flipInX wpb_start_animation animated"><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="title-xlarge" style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #054465;">PRESCHOOL PROGRAMME</span></div></div></div><div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 32px"><span class="vc_empty_space_inner"></span></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="vc_row-full-width-before"></div><div id="vc_row-6609055ee0cc6" data-vc-full-width="true" data-vc-full-width-init="true" class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1554460497080 vc_row-has-fill" style="position: relative; left: 0px; box-sizing: border-box; width: 779px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px;"><script type="text/javascript">if (typeof(gem_fix_fullwidth_position) == "function") { gem_fix_fullwidth_position(document.getElementById("vc_row-6609055ee0cc6")); }</script><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12"><div class="vc_column-inner "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1554460503230 vc_row-has-fill vc_row-o-content-middle vc_row-flex"><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill"><div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1554460418535"><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="wpb_single_image wpb_content_element vc_align_center  wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn vc_custom_1601212998946"><figure class="wpb_wrapper vc_figure"><div class="vc_single_image-wrapper   vc_box_border_grey"><img fetchpriority="high" decoding="async" width="600" height="362" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/DAY-02-138-1.png" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-full" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7a94"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7a94')</script><noscript><img fetchpriority="high" decoding="async" width="600" height="362" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/DAY-02-138-1.png" class="vc_single_image-img attachment-full" alt="" srcset="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/DAY-02-138-1.png 600w, https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/DAY-02-138-1-300x181.png 300w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px" /></noscript></div></figure></div></div></div></div><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6"><div class="vc_column-inner "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn general wpb_start_animation animated"><div class="wpb_wrapper"><p style="text-align: left;">Our programme aim to develop the Agape child to <strong><span style="color: #ca575e;">loves</span></strong> him/herself, and to love others as self; uses <span style="color: #afae44;"><strong>wisdom</strong></span> to discern right from wrong; values <span style="color: #f9b700;"><strong>integrity</strong></span> and seeks to live an honest life; possesses incredible <span style="color: #fa6900;"><strong>passion</strong></span> to do things well and strives for excellence in all undertakings; and demonstrates <span style="color: #184a7d;"><strong>discipline</strong> </span>and tenacity to withstand all odds to fulfill a dream.</p></div></div><div class="wpb_raw_code wpb_content_element wpb_raw_html"><div class="wpb_wrapper"> <iframe width="100%" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Se3l5KztNak" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="vc_row-full-width vc_clearfix"></div><div id="vc_row-6609055ee1819" class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid"><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12"><div class="vc_column-inner "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><p style="text-align: center;"><strong><a href="/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Preschool%20Food%20Menu%20FINAL.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">View HPB certified menu</a> | <a href="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/CW-Timetables-2019-1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">View Timetable</a></strong></p></div></div><div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 20px"><span class="vc_empty_space_inner"></span></div><div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid"><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6"><div class="vc_column-inner "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><h2><b>PRESCHOOL&nbsp;</b><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></h2><p><strong>Nursery 2 Age Group: 3 yrs.- 4 yrs.&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Kindergarten 1 &nbsp;Age Group: 4 yrs. – 5 yrs.</strong></p><p><strong>Kindergarten 2 &nbsp;Age Group: 5 yrs. -6 yrs.</strong></p><p>Our Inquiry-based learning programme (IBL) focuses on children’s innate abilities to explore, communicate and make meaning of the world they live in. IBL equips children with the 21st century skills to prepare them for success in an ever-changing world.</p><p>Using a systematic approach to inquiry, children combine the use of process skills (e.g. observation, communication, data handling) to find the answers to their questions. Children learn to think critically and solve real life problems.</p><p>Every unit of work is purposefully selected. The content of each unit is significant to children’s current experiences or issues around the world. Skills and knowledge such as language, literacy, mathematics and arts are integrated into each unit of work through engaging and relevant learning experiences in the classrooms and beyond.</p></div></div><div class="gem-button-container gem-button-position-left lazy-loading"><a class="gem-button gem-button-size-medium gem-button-style-flat gem-button-text-weight-normal lazy-loading-item" data-ll-effect="drop-right-without-wrap" style="border-radius: 0px;background-color: #f6aa0f;color: #ffffff;" onmouseleave="this.style.backgroundColor='#f6aa0f';this.style.color='#ffffff';" onmouseenter="this.style.backgroundColor='#262626';" href="http://agapelittleuni.com/curriculum/#preschool-curriculum" target="_self">View Preschool Curriculum</a></div></div></div></div><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6"><div class="vc_column-inner "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element "><div class="wpb_wrapper"><p><em><strong>Nursery 2</strong></em></p></div></div><div class="wpb_images_carousel wpb_content_element vc_clearfix wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn"><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div id="vc_images-carousel-1-1711867230" data-ride="vc_carousel" data-wrap="false" style="width: 600px;" 2</strong></em></p></div></div><div class="wpb_images_carousel wpb_content_element vc_clearfix"><div class="wpb_wrapper"><div id="vc_images-carousel-3-1711867230" data-ride="vc_carousel" class="vc_carousel-inner"><div class="vc_carousel-slideline" style="width: 1800px;"><div class="vc_carousel-slideline-inner"><div class="vc_item vc_active" style="width: 33.3333%; height: 0px;"><div data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7abd"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7abd')</script><noscript><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" class="" role="dialog" aria-modal="false" aria-labelledby="pum_popup_title_30706"><div id="popmake-30706" class="pum-container popmake theme-26324 pum-responsive pum-responsive-normal responsive size-normal"><div id="pum_popup_title_30706" class="pum-title popmake-title"> Programme Information &amp; Objectives for Different Levels</div><div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0"><table style="font-weight: 400;"><tbody><tr><th colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335551550&quot;:2,&quot;335551620&quot;:2,&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><b><span data-contrast="none">Grade</span></b>​</p></th><th colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335551550&quot;:2,&quot;335551620&quot;:2,&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><b><span data-contrast="none">Activity</span></b>​</p></th><th colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335551550&quot;:2,&quot;335551620&quot;:2,&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><b><span data-contrast="none">Focus/Objective</span></b>​</p></th></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="4" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335551550&quot;:2,&quot;335551620&quot;:2,&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span style="color: #ff6600;">PG, N1​</span></p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Exposure to Muse</span><span data-contrast="none">&nbsp;Arts&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">Teaching Methodology</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Introducing</span><span data-contrast="none"> Music as a form of Instruction</span>​</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Instill Muse Arts Routine&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">&nbsp;</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Allow the child to better understand our&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">requirements of them during each lesson. Setting&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">ground</span><span data-contrast="none"> rules on when to play and when to listen.</span>​</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Building</span><span data-contrast="none"> their music foundation via the&nbsp; </span><span data-contrast="none">introduction of Music and&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">Movement with Music</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Getting used to move</span><span data-contrast="none">&nbsp;in a coordinated motion with&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">the Music.</span>​</p><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Instilling a culture of Freedom within Limits’.</span>​</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Exposure to Musical&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">Instruments</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Year 1: Percussion Instruments</span>​</p><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Year 2: Melodic Instruments</span>​</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="3" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335551550&quot;:2,&quot;335551620&quot;:2,&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; color: #ff6600;">N2,&nbsp;K1,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; color: #ff6600;">K2</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Reinforcing Muse Arts’ </span><span data-contrast="none">Teaching Methodology and&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">Routine</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Instilling</span><span data-contrast="none">&nbsp;our Teaching Methodology and Routine to&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">become second nature in them to enhance its </span><span data-contrast="none">effectiveness for the purpose preparing them to </span><span data-contrast="none">participate in activities that require a stricter control&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">of progress, and adherence to time line, </span><span data-contrast="none">e.g.</span><span data-contrast="none">, Preparation </span><span data-contrast="none">for a Performance.</span>​</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Exposure to&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">orchestrated&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">performances</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Learning to work together and listen to each other&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">so as to create a cohesive musical piece.</span>​</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0,&quot;335559685&quot;:0,&quot;335559731&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Exposing</span><span data-contrast="none">&nbsp;them to more&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">specific musical instruments,&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">such as Keyboard / Ukulele /&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="none">Xylophone</span>​</p></td><td colspan="1" rowspan="1" data-celllook="0"><p data-ccp-props="{&quot;335559683&quot;:0}"><span data-contrast="none">Further</span><span data-contrast="none"> enhancement to their musical knowledge via </span><span data-contrast="none">exposure to more specific Musical </span><span data-contrast="none">Instruments. This allows parents to discover their </span><span data-contrast="none">child’s area of interest.</span>​</p></td></tr></tbody></table></div> <button type="button" class="pum-close popmake-close" aria-label="Close"> x </button></div></div><div id="pum-31346" class="pum pum-overlay pum-theme-26324 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay pum-click-to-close click_open" data-popmake="{&quot;id&quot;:31346,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;student-care-tuition-schedule&quot;,&quot;theme_id&quot;:26324,&quot;cookies&quot;:[],&quot;triggers&quot;:[{&quot;type&quot;:&quot;click_open&quot;,&quot;settings&quot;:{&quot;cookie_name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;extra_selectors&quot;:&quot;.tuition-schedule&quot;}}],&quot;mobile_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;tablet_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;meta&quot;:{&quot;display&quot;:{&quot;stackable&quot;:false,&quot;overlay_disabled&quot;:false,&quot;scrollable_content&quot;:false,&quot;disable_reposition&quot;:false,&quot;size&quot;:&quot;large&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width&quot;:&quot;0%&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;responsive_max_width&quot;:&quot;100%&quot;,&quot;responsive_max_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_width&quot;:&quot;640px&quot;,&quot;custom_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height&quot;:&quot;380px&quot;,&quot;custom_height_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height_auto&quot;:false,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;position_from_trigger&quot;:false,&quot;position_top&quot;:&quot;100&quot;,&quot;position_left&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_bottom&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_right&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_fixed&quot;:false,&quot;animation_type&quot;:&quot;fade&quot;,&quot;animation_speed&quot;:&quot;350&quot;,&quot;animation_origin&quot;:&quot;center role="dialog" aria-modal="false"><div id="popmake-31346" class="pum-container popmake theme-26324 pum-responsive pum-responsive-large responsive size-large"><div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0"><h3 data-pbs-phone-margin-bottom="-10px">Student Care Tuition Schedule (School Terms)</h3><p>Check out the latest schedule of our programmes.</p><p>For enquiries, please call : <a href="tel:67646126">6764 6126</a>.</p><p>If a student is enrolled after the term has started, pro-rated tuition fees will be chargeable for the remaining number of lessons.</p><p>Registration fee of $30 and materials fee are payable except for existing agape students.</p><p>Deposit of $100&nbsp; is required for each subject.</p><p style="text-align: left;">*You are welcomed to call and check if we are able to arrange for any alternative timing if your child is not available for the following timing.<br> <strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><table class=" aligncenter" width="648"><tbody><tr><td width="210"><strong>Programmes</strong></td><td width="102"><strong>Level</strong></td><td width="336"><strong>Schedule</strong></td></tr><tr><td width="210">Chinese<p></p><p>$225 per 9 2019)</p></td></tr><tr><td width="210">Chinese<p></p><p>$270 per 9 lessons</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td><td width="102">Primary 3</td><td width="336">Thursday, 5.30 pm – 7.00 pm<p></p><p>(Commencement Date : 19 Sep 2019)</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td width="210">Chinese<p></p><p>$270 per 9 lessons</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td><td width="102">Primary 4</td><td width="336">Friday, 2.30 pm – 4.00 pm<p></p><p>(Commencement Date : 20 Sep 2019)</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td width="210">Chinese<p></p><p>$315 per 9 lessons</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td><td width="102">Primary 5</td><td 2019)</p></td></tr><tr><td width="210">English<p></p><p>$270 per 9 lessons</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td><td width="102">Primary 3</td><td width="336">Wednesday, 4.00 pm – 5.30 pm<p></p><p>(Commencement Date : 18 Sep 2019)</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td width="210">Mathematics<p></p><p>$270 per 9 lessons</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td><td width="102">Primary 3</td><td width="336">Tuesday, 5.30 pm – 6.15 pm<p></p><p><strong>Wednesday, 1.45 pm – 2.30 pm</strong></p><p>(Commencement Date : 17 Sep 2019)</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p style="text-align: center;"></p><p style="text-align: left;">** If a student is enrolled after the term has started, pro rata tuition fees will be charged for the remaining number of lessons.</p><p style="text-align: left;">** Existing Agape’s students will be entitled to a waiver for the registration fee of $30 and material fee of $10 for each course registered. Non-Agape students are required to pay both.</p><p style="text-align: left;">** You are welcomed to call and check if we are able to arrange for any alternative timing for the above classes if your child is not available on the above timings.</p></div> <button type="button" class="pum-close popmake-close" aria-label="Close"> x </button></div></div><div id="pum-26330" class="pum pum-overlay pum-theme-26324 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay pum-click-to-close click_open" data-popmake="{&quot;id&quot;:26330,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;infant-care-lesson-plan&quot;,&quot;theme_id&quot;:26324,&quot;cookies&quot;:[],&quot;triggers&quot;:[{&quot;type&quot;:&quot;click_open&quot;,&quot;settings&quot;:{&quot;cookie_name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;extra_selectors&quot;:&quot;.infantcare&quot;}}],&quot;mobile_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;tablet_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;meta&quot;:{&quot;display&quot;:{&quot;stackable&quot;:false,&quot;overlay_disabled&quot;:false,&quot;scrollable_content&quot;:false,&quot;disable_reposition&quot;:false,&quot;size&quot;:&quot;normal&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width&quot;:&quot;0%&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;responsive_max_width&quot;:&quot;100%&quot;,&quot;responsive_max_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_width&quot;:&quot;640px&quot;,&quot;custom_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height&quot;:&quot;380px&quot;,&quot;custom_height_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height_auto&quot;:false,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;position_from_trigger&quot;:false,&quot;position_top&quot;:&quot;100&quot;,&quot;position_left&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_bottom&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_right&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_fixed&quot;:false,&quot;animation_type&quot;:&quot;fade&quot;,&quot;animation_speed&quot;:&quot;350&quot;,&quot;animation_origin&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;overlay_zindex&quot;:false,&quot;zindex&quot;:&quot;1999999999&quot;},&quot;close&quot;:{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;x&quot;,&quot;button_delay&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;overlay_click&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;esc_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;f4_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;},&quot;click_open&quot;:[]}}" role="dialog" aria-modal="false" aria-labelledby="pum_popup_title_26330"><div id="popmake-26330" class="pum-container popmake theme-26324 pum-responsive pum-responsive-normal responsive size-normal"><div id="pum_popup_title_26330" class="pum-title popmake-title"> FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE</div><div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0"><p>&nbsp;</p><table><tbody><tr><th style="width: 30%;">Activities</th><th style="width: 70%;">What do we do everyday?</th></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Arrival and Breakfast</span><p></p><p><img decoding="async" class="alignnone wp-image-26332" style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit;" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/cereal.png" alt="" width="107" height="76" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7afb"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7afb')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class="alignnone wp-image-26332" style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit;" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/cereal.png" alt="" width="107" height="76" /></noscript></p></td><td>Infant and toddlers arrive at any time according to the family’s schedule. For infants who arrive early, a good breakfast will keep them fulfilled and happy for the day</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Morning Greetings</span></td><td>A time for Educarers to greet every child and share a song/book with the children</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Large Group Time</span></td><td><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26337 alignright" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/baby-abc-1.png" alt="" width="114" height="142" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b43"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b43')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26337 alignright" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/baby-abc-1.png" alt="" width="114" height="142" /></noscript>Infants and toddlers gather and engage in holistic activities</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Discovery Time</span></td><td>A time for infants and toddlers to explore the different materials and equipment in their learning environment. The infants and toddlers are free to choose what they want to do according to their interests</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Small Group Time</span></td><td>An opportunity for Educarers and infants/toddlers to share learning moments in a small group<p></p><p><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26338 alignleft" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/baby-dance.png" alt="" width="140" height="174" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b47"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b47')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26338 alignleft" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/baby-dance.png" alt="" width="140" height="174" /></noscript></p></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Outdoor Time</span></td><td>A time for infants/toddlers to explore the environment beyond the classroom environment. It includes time to engage in planned gross motor activities</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Lunch</span><p></p><p><img decoding="async" class="alignnone wp-image-26339" style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit;" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/bread.png" alt="" width="119" height="84" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b4c"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b4c')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class="alignnone wp-image-26339" style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit;" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/bread.png" alt="" width="119" height="84" /></noscript></p></td><td>An unhurried time to sit together, communicate and serve lunch to the infants/toddlers</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Nap Time</span></td><td>A time for infant and toddler to rest according to their natural sleeping time</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Shower / Diaper Time</span></td><td><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26340 alignright" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/sleeping.png" alt="" width="104" height="122" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b52"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b52')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26340 alignright" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/sleeping.png" alt="" width="104" height="122" /></noscript>A time to bond with the infants/toddlers through shower/diaper time</td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Departure</span></td><td>A time to communicate with parents about the happenings in the day; and to model respectful communications with our various stakeholders</td></tr></tbody></table><p><em>Adapted from: Holt (2010). Bringing the High/Scope Approach to your Early Years Practice.NZ: Routledge. </em></p></div> <button type="button" class="pum-close popmake-close" aria-label="Close"> x </button></div></div><div id="pum-31443" class="pum pum-overlay pum-theme-26324 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay click_open" data-popmake="{&quot;id&quot;:31443,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;agape-map-hq&quot;,&quot;theme_id&quot;:26324,&quot;cookies&quot;:[],&quot;triggers&quot;:[{&quot;type&quot;:&quot;click_open&quot;,&quot;settings&quot;:{&quot;cookie_name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;extra_selectors&quot;:&quot;.map-hq&quot;}}],&quot;mobile_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;tablet_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;meta&quot;:{&quot;display&quot;:{&quot;stackable&quot;:false,&quot;overlay_disabled&quot;:false,&quot;scrollable_content&quot;:false,&quot;disable_reposition&quot;:false,&quot;size&quot;:&quot;small&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width&quot;:&quot;0%&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;responsive_max_width&quot;:&quot;100%&quot;,&quot;responsive_max_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_width&quot;:&quot;640px&quot;,&quot;custom_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height&quot;:&quot;380px&quot;,&quot;custom_height_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height_auto&quot;:false,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;overlay_zindex&quot;:false,&quot;zindex&quot;:&quot;1999999999&quot;},&quot;close&quot;:{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;button_delay&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;overlay_click&quot;:false,&quot;esc_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;f4_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;},&quot;click_open&quot;:[]}}" role="dialog" aria-modal="false"><div id="popmake-31443" class="pum-container popmake theme-26324 pum-responsive pum-responsive-small responsive size-small"><div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0"><h5>HQ &amp; TRAINING CENTRE</h5><p>Tel:&nbsp;<a href="tel:64797002">6479 7002</a><br> Email:&nbsp;<a href="mailto:enquiry@agapeLittleUni.com">enquiry@agapeLittleUni.com</a></p><p><iframe style="border: 0;" src="https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d3988.7844823447344!2d103.79479711486589!3d1.3043576620829869!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x31da1a40bafcd06b%3A0x934d55f8f9d64fdb!2sOne+Commonwealth!5e0!3m2!1sen!2ssg!4v1555319110939!5m2!1sen!2ssg" width="100%" height="400" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"><span data-mce-type="bookmark" style="display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;" class="mce_SELRES_start">﻿</span></iframe></p></div> <button type="button" class="pum-close popmake-close" aria-label="Close"> x </button></div></div><div id="pum-26345" class="pum pum-overlay pum-theme-26324 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay pum-click-to-close click_open" data-popmake="{&quot;id&quot;:26345,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;7-step-teaching-strategy&quot;,&quot;theme_id&quot;:26324,&quot;cookies&quot;:[],&quot;triggers&quot;:[{&quot;type&quot;:&quot;click_open&quot;,&quot;settings&quot;:{&quot;cookie_name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;extra_selectors&quot;:&quot;.7teaching&quot;}}],&quot;mobile_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;tablet_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;meta&quot;:{&quot;display&quot;:{&quot;stackable&quot;:false,&quot;overlay_disabled&quot;:false,&quot;scrollable_content&quot;:false,&quot;disable_reposition&quot;:false,&quot;size&quot;:&quot;normal&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width&quot;:&quot;0%&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;responsive_max_width&quot;:&quot;100%&quot;,&quot;responsive_max_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_width&quot;:&quot;640px&quot;,&quot;custom_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height&quot;:&quot;380px&quot;,&quot;custom_height_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height_auto&quot;:false,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;position_from_trigger&quot;:false,&quot;position_top&quot;:&quot;100&quot;,&quot;position_left&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_bottom&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_right&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_fixed&quot;:false,&quot;animation_type&quot;:&quot;fade&quot;,&quot;animation_speed&quot;:&quot;350&quot;,&quot;animation_origin&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;overlay_zindex&quot;:false,&quot;zindex&quot;:&quot;1999999999&quot;},&quot;close&quot;:{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;x&quot;,&quot;button_delay&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;overlay_click&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;esc_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;f4_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;},&quot;click_open&quot;:[]}}" role="dialog" aria-modal="false" aria-labelledby="pum_popup_title_26345"><div id="popmake-26345" class="pum-container popmake theme-26324 pum-responsive pum-responsive-normal responsive size-normal"><div id="pum_popup_title_26345" class="pum-title popmake-title"> Facilitating Inquiry Work through the 7-Step Teaching Strategy</div><div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0"><p>In Agape Little Uni, inquiries are carried out using the 7-step teaching strategy. The 7-step teaching strategy provides a systematic way to engage children purposefully and meaningfully.</p><table><tbody><tr><th style="width: 20%;">Step</th><th style="width: 50%;">Description</th><th style="width: 30%;">Suggested Activities</th></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Tuning In</span></td><td>The main purpose of <em>Tuning In</em> is to stimulate children’s interests in the topic of study.</td><td><ul><li>Storytelling</li><li>Songs and Rhymes</li><li>Picture Talk</li><li>Field Trip</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Storytelling <img decoding="async" class="alignnone wp-image-26347" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/storybook-300x223.png" alt="" width="148" height="109" data-tgpli-srcset="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/storybook-300x223.png 300w, https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/storybook.png 342w" sizes="(max-width: 148px) 100vw, 148px" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b59"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b59')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class="alignnone wp-image-26347" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/storybook-300x223.png" alt="" width="148" height="109" srcset="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/storybook-300x223.png 300w, https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/storybook.png 342w" sizes="(max-width: 148px) 100vw, 148px" /></noscript></span></td><td>The teacher finds a suitable story that is related to the topic of the week. She models good reading habits and spoken language. She&nbsp;reads the story with expressions and intonation to gain the children’s attention.</td><td><ul><li>Puppetry</li><li>Picture Talk</li><li>Dramatization</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Role Play</span></td><td>With regards to the topic of the week, teachers plan learning<br> experiences which allow children to enact a role or an action.</td><td><ul><li>Mathematical activities</li><li>Discovery activities</li><li>Cookery</li><li>Puppetry</li><li>Songs and Rhymes</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Art and Craft</span></td><td>Children get to master their fine motor skills and work on 2-D and 3-D artwork with regards to the topic of study.</td><td><ul><li>Creating 2-D and 3-D artwork <img decoding="async" class="wp-image-26348 alignright" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/artbrush-1-300x223.png" alt="" width="133" height="99" data-tgpli-srcset="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/artbrush-1-300x223.png 300w, https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/artbrush-1.png 342w" sizes="(max-width: 133px) 100vw, 133px" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b65"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b65')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class="wp-image-26348 alignright" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/artbrush-1-300x223.png" alt="" width="133" height="99" srcset="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/artbrush-1-300x223.png 300w, https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/artbrush-1.png 342w" sizes="(max-width: 133px) 100vw, 133px" /></noscript></li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Cleaning Up</span></td><td><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26350 alignright" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/cleaning.png" alt="" width="119" height="141" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b6b"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b6b')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26350 alignright" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/cleaning.png" alt="" width="119" height="141" /></noscript>Children learn to clean and pack up after completing their activities.</td><td><ul><li>Wipe the tables</li><li>Putting things back to its original places</li><li>Washing of hands and tools</li><li>Sweeping</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Cooling Down<img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26336 alignright" data-tgpli-src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/music-1.png" alt="" width="87" height="98" data-tgpli-inited="" data-tgpli-image-inited="" id="tgpli-6609055ee7b6f"><script>window.tgpQueue.add('tgpli-6609055ee7b6f')</script><noscript><img decoding="async" class=" wp-image-26336 alignright" src="https://www.agapelittleuni.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/music-1.png" alt="" width="87" height="98" /></noscript></span></td><td>After the children have participated actively in the preceding activities, they take this time to calm down.</td><td><ul><li>Listen to a soothing music</li><li>Close eyes and rest</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Wrap Up</span><p></p><p>&nbsp;</p></td><td>Teachers recall the activities that were done in the day and<br> reinforce what was taught during these activities.</td><td>Recall<p></p><ul><li><span style="font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit;">A story</span></li><li>A song</li><li>A rhyme</li><li>A word/phrase</li><li>An action</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table></div> <button type="button" class="pum-close popmake-close" aria-label="Close"> x </button></div></div><div id="pum-26353" class="pum pum-overlay pum-theme-26324 pum-theme-default-theme popmake-overlay pum-click-to-close click_open" data-popmake="{&quot;id&quot;:26353,&quot;slug&quot;:&quot;principles-of-teaching-and-learning-in-early-years-curriculum&quot;,&quot;theme_id&quot;:26324,&quot;cookies&quot;:[],&quot;triggers&quot;:[{&quot;type&quot;:&quot;click_open&quot;,&quot;settings&quot;:{&quot;cookie_name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;extra_selectors&quot;:&quot;.principles&quot;}}],&quot;mobile_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;tablet_disabled&quot;:null,&quot;meta&quot;:{&quot;display&quot;:{&quot;stackable&quot;:false,&quot;overlay_disabled&quot;:false,&quot;scrollable_content&quot;:false,&quot;disable_reposition&quot;:false,&quot;size&quot;:&quot;normal&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width&quot;:&quot;0%&quot;,&quot;responsive_min_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;responsive_max_width&quot;:&quot;100%&quot;,&quot;responsive_max_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_width&quot;:&quot;640px&quot;,&quot;custom_width_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height&quot;:&quot;380px&quot;,&quot;custom_height_unit&quot;:false,&quot;custom_height_auto&quot;:false,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;position_from_trigger&quot;:false,&quot;position_top&quot;:&quot;100&quot;,&quot;position_left&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_bottom&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_right&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;position_fixed&quot;:false,&quot;animation_type&quot;:&quot;fade&quot;,&quot;animation_speed&quot;:&quot;350&quot;,&quot;animation_origin&quot;:&quot;center top&quot;,&quot;overlay_zindex&quot;:false,&quot;zindex&quot;:&quot;1999999999&quot;},&quot;close&quot;:{&quot;text&quot;:&quot;x&quot;,&quot;button_delay&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;overlay_click&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;esc_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;f4_press&quot;:&quot;1&quot;},&quot;click_open&quot;:[]}}" role="dialog" aria-modal="false" aria-labelledby="pum_popup_title_26353"><div id="popmake-26353" class="pum-container popmake theme-26324 pum-responsive pum-responsive-normal responsive size-normal"><div id="pum_popup_title_26353" class="pum-title popmake-title"> Principles of Teaching and Learning in Early Years Curriculum</div><div class="pum-content popmake-content" tabindex="0"><p>&nbsp;</p><table><tbody><tr><th style="width: 20%;">Agape Principle</th><th style="width: 50%;">What it looks like in practice?</th><th style="width: 30%;">Related EYDF<br> Guiding Principles</th></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Active and<br> Authentic<br> Learning<br> Experiences</span></td><td><ul><li>Provide concrete and real-life materials for learning</li><li>Plan learning experiences that include an integration of various learning areas</li><li>Allow children to experiment new ideas through play and planned learning experiences</li><li>Children are able to connect classroom learning experiences with real-life experiences</li><li>Learning experiences provide choices</li><li>Learning experiences cater to the different interests and developmental stage of young children</li><li>Learning experiences derived from assessment of children’s learning on a regular basis</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>The Developing Child</li><li>The Intentional Programme</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Positive<br> Connections</span></td><td><ul><li>Teachers work closely with parents in curriculum making</li><li>Teachers use positive language to communicate with young children and their families</li><li>Teachers observe and plan respectful learning experiences that embraces the diverse backgrounds of young children</li><li>Teachers model good language and tone when communicate with children&nbsp;during routines, transitions and learning experiences</li><li>Centre may invite professionals to provide talks and workshops to keep our parents abreast of the latest<br> development in infant services and care for young children</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>The Involved Family</li><li>The Professional Educarer</li><li>The Intentional Programme</li><li>The Engaged Community</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Authentic<br> Assessment</span></td><td><ul><li>Ongoing assessment of children’s learning is carried out everyday</li><li>Teacher has a systematic plan to observe and record children’s progress on a regular basis</li><li>The content of each summary report is based on regular documentations of children’s learning</li><li>Assessment processes include children’s views and voices</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>The Developing Child</li><li>The Involved Family</li><li>The Professional Educarer</li><li>The Intentional Programme</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><span style="color: #ff6600;">Guidance,<br> Empowerment<br> and Support</span></td><td><ul><li>Teachers and children are co-learners in the classroom</li><li>Teachers develop children’s critical thinking skills by asking effective and age-appropriate questions</li><li>Teachers create a conducive and rich environment for learning</li><li>The learning environment promotes opportunities for choice-making and interactions</li><li>Teachers provide feedback and encourage children to improve their own work</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>The Developing Child</li><li>The Involved Family</li><li>The Professional Educarer</li><li>The Intentional Programme</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table></div> <button type="button" class="pum-close popmake-close" aria-label="Close"> x </button></div></div> <!-- Meta Pixel jQuery(".cfx_form_main,.wpcf7-form,.wpforms-form,.gform_wrapper form").each(function(){
var form=jQuery(this); 
var screen_width=""; var screen_height="";
 if(screen_width == ""){
 if(screen){
 screen_width=screen.width; 
 }else{
 screen_width=jQuery(window).width();
 }    } 
 if(screen_height == ""){
 if(screen){
 screen_height=screen.height; 
 }else{
 screen_height=jQuery(window).height();
 }    }
form.append('<input type="hidden" name="vx_width" value="'+screen_width+'">');
form.append('<input type="hidden" name="vx_height" value="'+screen_height+'">');
form.append('<input type="hidden" name="vx_url" value="'+window.location.href+'">'); 
}); 
}); </script> <script src="https://lmgonzalves.github.io/segment/dist/segment.min.js"></script> <script type="text/javascript"> //setup
 var divs = jQuery("div.date > div.item");
 for(var i = 0; i < divs.length; i+=4) {
 divs.slice(i, i+4).wrapAll("<div class='drow'></div>");
 }
 var svg = [];
 var line = Math.ceil(jQuery('div.date div.item').length/4);
 if(line%2==0) jQuery('.thetimeline').addClass('even');
 else jQuery('.thetimeline').addClass('odd');
 //color
 jQuery('.thetimeline').addClass('color'+line%4);
 //add clast to point 2
 pos = jQuery('div.date div.item').length%4;
 jQuery('.thetimeline').addClass('pos'+pos);
 per = ["90%","40%","60%","70%"];
 time = [2.8,1,1.6,2]
 //init line path
 for(i=2;i<=line;i++){
 if(i%2==0){
 jQuery('<svg viewBox="0 0 942 258"><path id="path'+i+'" class="st0" d="M927,0c0,119-81,129-81,129H96c0,0-81,10-81,129"/></svg>').insertBefore('.point1');
 }else{
 jQuery('<svg viewBox="0 0 942 258"><path id="path'+i+'" class="st0" d="M15,0c0,119,81,129,81,129h750c0,0,81,10,81,129"/></svg>').insertBefore('.point1');
 }
 }
 console.log(line);
 var count = jQuery('.st0').length;
 function drawpath(i){
 console.log("path"+i);
 path = "path"+i;
 jQuery('.svgtimeline svg').eq(i-1).addClass('act');
 jQuery('.date .drow').eq(i-1).addClass('act');
 if(i>count) return;
 var myPath = document.getElementById(path),
 segment = new Segment(myPath);
 segment.draw("0", "0", 0);  if(i==line)
 segment.draw("0", per[pos], time[pos],{
 callback: function(){
 if(i==line) jQuery('.thetimeline').addClass('done');
 }
 });else
 segment.draw("0", "100%", 3,{
 callback: function(){
 drawpath(i+1);
 }
 });  }
 function initpath(){
 emptypath("path1");
 console.log('run');
 }
 //emptypath();
 draw = true;
 if(jQuery('#thetimeline').length>0)
 jQuery(window).scroll(function() {
 if(draw){
 var hT = jQuery('#thetimeline').offset().top,
 hH = jQuery('#thetimeline').outerHeight(),
 wH = jQuery(window).height(),
 wS = jQuery(this).scrollTop();
 if (wS > (hT+hH-wH)){
 drawpath(1);
 draw=false;
 }
 }
 }); 
 if (jQuery('#curriculum-tab').length) { 
 jQuery(".vc_tta-tab > a").on("click", function(e) {
 //e.preventDefault();
 jQuery(".vc_tta-tab").removeClass('vc_active');
 jQuery(this).parent().addClass('vc_active');
 let getID = jQuery(this).attr('href');
 let setURL = getID.split('#');
 window.history.pushState(null, null, '/curriculum/' + setURL[1]);
 jQuery('.vc_tta-panel').removeClass('vc_active').hide();
 jQuery(getID).addClass('vc_active').show();
 // e.stopPropagation();
 });
 }
